alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Huron; Seneca (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 5:44PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Richland, Huron, southeastern Seneca, northwestern Ashland and northeastern Crawford Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 544 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Washington, or 12 miles northeast of Bucyrus, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Norwalk, Shelby, Willard, New London, Plymouth, New Washington, Chatfield, Greenwich, Attica, North Fairfield, Tiro and Sulpher Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
